replies.msg:
Liverpool are in official contact with RB Leipzig as they attempt to bring forward Naby Keïta’s arrival as Philippe Coutinho’s replacement, writes @_pauljoyce

Klopp wants Keïta this month to bolster his side’s Champions League push, and Liverpool will pay another premium before the Guinea midfielder’s scheduled £57million move on July 1. (Paul Joyce)

Keïta, who has started learning English, wants to move and his status in the Leipzig dressing room has been diminished, with team-mates believing that his performances have dropped below the standards he set last season due to his focus already being on Anfield. (Paul Joyce)

replies.msg:
ECHO - Emre Can eyes glory with Liverpool as contract saga rumbles on

Emre Can, who celebrates his 24th birthday on Friday, has his sights set on lifting a trophy with Liverpool before heading to the World Cup in Russia.

“First of all there are still many games with Liverpool to concentrate on, but I hope to be able to stay healthy and go to the World Cup in the summer,” Can said.

“We have been in a good way and we want to try to continue winning as many games as possible and hopefully that can mean having a good run in the FA Cup as well as the Premier League and the Champions League.

“We want to win a trophy. We are full of belief that winning a title is something this squad is capable of achieving and we will give our best.”

Thomas Lemar remains on Klopp's radar but Liverpool have yet to re-ignite the negotiations which took place last summer. Initially reluctant to sell mid-season, Monaco have been making noises this week that they might be prepared to do business. (James Pearce)

replies.msg:
The kind of game everyone wants to play in' is how Sadio Mané has described Sunday's showdown with Manchester City at Anfield – and he insists Liverpool go into the clash with the league leaders full of confidence. (@LFC)

Mané: “It will not be easy because Manchester City are one of the best teams in the league, but we also have great qualities and a great team; we can beat anyone, not just in the league, but Europe too. It will be a tough game, but I’m very much looking forward to it.”

Mané: “The confidence is here, everyone is enjoying playing and now we are just waiting for Sunday to show we have the confidence and we can win the game.”

Mané: “I am just trying to work hard in training all the time, give my best every single game and try and score or assist for my team. Eight goals is good but I know myself and I know what I can give for the team, so I am confident I will score more goals and help the team.”
